basics.name: Stephanie Aelmore
basics.label: B.S. Candidate, Computer Engineering
basics.summary: Software developer with diverse hardware-focused experience with an interest in novel computing techlonogy and a passion for art and interactive media. Expected gradutation date: May 2022.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.summary: Teaching Assistant for Basic Circuit Analysis II
highlights: Teach/lead a general Electrical Engineering laboratory section (as assigned), hold office hours, grade lab reports, prepare and grade quizzes OR tutor students in a general electrical engineering room (as assigned).

work.summary: Research assistant for DoD basic research projects
highlights: Evaluated, developed, and implemented asynchronous computer vision algorithms
Designed, performed, and analyzed experiments functionalizing semiconductor quantum dots and ionogels

work.summary: Served as technical consultant and operator on reactor instrumentation and control systems
highlights: Over a year as Lead Supervisor, provided direct mentorship over 10 people resulting in four promotions and three performance-based awards
Led department-wide classroom training on reactor theory and instrumentation, leading to the department achieving top scores three years in a row on operational examinations
Served as Chief Technical Consultant on reactor instrumentation and control systems for three weeks of safe submerged operations

volunteer.position: Lead Software Engineer for Instrumentation and Control Subsystem
volunteer.summary: Lead Software Engineer for Instrumentation and Control Subsystem
highlights: Designed rover control software architecture using ROS
Developed rover testing plan with continuous intergration

awards.title: Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal
awards.summary: Awarded four times for outstanding technical skills and leadership ability.
